SNAPCAST.D_SERVER:
Configure the basic server settings; such as sound quality, codec and stream name for the MPD playback.
Note: if defaults are not changed, no CLI comments are added for those settings.
SNAPCAST.D_MAIN_PIPE_NAME: Snapcast main stream name (for example: MPD), as shown in clients.
SNAPCAST.D_SAMPLE_RATE: The number of samples per second.
SNAPCAST.D_BIT_DEPTH: The number of bits of information in each sample.
SNAPCAST.D_CHANNELS: The amount of channels to output (2 = stereo).
SNAPCAST.D_CODEC: The codec used for the stream.
SNAPCAST.D_CLIENT: Configure the local snapclient, you can either connect to the local server or another one in the network. Please note that the listed hosts are not necessarily snapservers, these are merely Volumio instances.
SNAPCAST.D_VOLUMIOHOST: Choose a Volumio host, note: you still need to verify and install the SnapServer on that host.
SNAPCAST.D_SOUNDCARD: The soundcard you wish to use for the SnapCast client output.
SNAPCAST.D_CUSTOMHOST: Define a custom SnapCast client host ID.
SNAPCAST.D_HOSTID: Define a SnapCast host by filling in its ID.
SNAPCAST.D_CLI:
This field allows you to add CLI commands to your setup.
You can find the commands here: https://github.com/badaix/snapcast#Configuration
SNAPCAST.DD_CLI: The CLI commands will be appended to the config. In the case of leading spaces, prefix the string with a backslash (\).
SNAPCAST.D_MPD: Configure MPD output for synchronized playback and set the correct sound quality. 48kHz @ 16 bits over two channels is advised and allows for flawless playback.
SNAPCAST.D_PATCH_MPD_CONF: Patch the mpd.conf file with the settings configured in the plugin.
SNAPCAST.D_MPD_SAMPLE_RATE: The number of samples per second MPD should recalculate to, 48000kHz is advised for best performance.
SNAPCAST.D_MPD_BIT_DEPTH: The number of bits of information in each sample MPD should reformat to.
SNAPCAST.D_MPD_CHANNELS: The number of channels MPD should reformat to.
SNAPCAST.D_ENABLE_ALSA_MPD: When set to off, it disables direct output to ALSA from MPD.
SNAPCAST.D_ENABLE_FIFO_MPD: When set to off, it disables direct output to FIFO from MPD.
SNAPCAST.D_PATCHASOUND: Patch ALSA sound configuration (asound.conf) for snapcast.
SNAPCAST.D_ASOUND_CONF: Location of the global ALSA configuration file.
SNAPCAST.D_SPOTIFY: Configure the Spotify plugin settings to enabled output to a named pipe, enabling synchronized playback. Please bear in mind that changing these settings are not in effect immediately, you'll need to restart whatever implementation you've chosen afterwards.
SNAPCAST.D_SPOTIFY_DEDICATED_STREAM: This en- or disables a dedicated stream for the Spotify implementation.
SNAPCAST.D_SPOTIFY_PIPE_NAME: Snapcast stream name for Spotify, as shown in clients.
SNAPCAST.D_SPOTIFY_IMPLEMENTATION: Type of implementation used to play Spotify.
SNAPCAST.D_EXPOSE_ADDITIONAL_SPOTIFY_SETTINGS: Exposes additional settings for the standalone librespot implementation, the other implementations have their own settings pages.
SNAPCAST.D_LIBRESPOT_LOCATION: The absolute location of the librespot library e.g. /usr/local/bin/librespot.
SNAPCAST.D_SPOTIFY_USERNAME: Username of the Spotify account you wish to use.
SNAPCAST.D_SPOTIFY_PASSWORD: Password of the Spotify account you wish to use.
SNAPCAST.D_SPOTIFY_DEVICENAME: This will be displayed in Spotify when choosing different playback devices.
SNAPCAST.D_SPOTIFY_BITRATE: Default bitrate is 320, this affect sound quality.
SNAPCAST.D_PATCHTEMPLATES: Patch the known Spotify configuration template for the below described implementation.
SNAPCAST.D_SELECTED_IMPLEMENTATION: Displays the selected implementation and will patch the corresponding template.
SNAPCAST.D_SNAPENVIRONMENT: Configure the SnapServer streams and which stream to controle the volume for (on the playback tab). You might need to refresh the page after installation of the plugin.
SNAPCAST.CLIENT_ID: Select the client for which you want to control the volume for
SNAPCAST.D_CLIENT_ID: Select a client from the drop-down menu for which you want to control the volume for using the Volumio UI. The clients shown are loaded upon page-load, re-opening the plugin settings may cause the drop-down to show different clients. The volume control is event-based, changing the volume will update the client volume using the SnapServer API; it might take a few seconds (in the test environment the volume update was instant).
SNAPCAST.D_SWITCH_STREAM: Toggles visibility for the fields to assign streams to clients (group).
SNAPCAST.LINKED_CLIENT_ID: Client to link to the specified stream
SNAPCAST.D_LINKED_CLIENT_ID: The client shown will is in a group, the entire group however will be linked to the stream selected. I have no idea how to nicely show the multi-dimensional environment of groups (connected to a single stream) and clients (connected to a single group).
SNAPCAST.STREAM_ID: Select the stream you want to add the client to
SNAPCAST.D_STREAM_ID: The drop-down will show the streams loaded upon page-load. The stream names are the pipe-names defined in the settings (MPD or Spotify).
